availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. titleStmt.title: Quæstiones in sacra theologia discutiendæ Oxonii in vesperiis duodecimo die Iulii, ann. Dom. 1634
titleStmt.author: University of Oxford.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.

projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,363 texts created during Phase 1 of the project have been released into the public domain as of 1 January 2015. Anyone can now take and use these texts for their own purposes, but we respectfully request that due credit and attribution is given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

revisionDesc.change: 2007-10 AptaraKeyed and coded from ProQuest page images
2008-02 Mona LogarboText and markup reviewed and edited

div.head: QVAESTIONES IN SACRA THEOLOGIA DISCVTIENDAE OXONII IN VESPERIIS DVODECIMO Die Iul •• Ann. Dom. 1634.
Quaſtiones Inceptoris RICH. BAYLIE.
div.p:
An divina providentia
ad rectum vſ
que minima pertingat? Aff.
rebus praeviſis imponat neceſſitatem? Neg.
ad finem ſupernaturalem genus humanum ordinaverit? Aff.

div.head: Quaſtiones Inceptoris THOMAE LAWRENCE.
div.p:
An
Iuſtè excōmunicati à viſibili Eccleſiâ, membra cenſendi ſint inviſibilis? N.
Chriſtus localiter deſcenderit ad inferos? Aff.
Coelibatus Sacerdotum ſit neceſſariò ordinibus annectendus? Neg.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Ince ••• ris IOH: ELLY.
div.p:
An
Sancti ſint ad orandi? Neg.
Imagines ſint colendae? Neg.
Dies feſti ſint ſanctis dicandi? Neg.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Inceptoris THOM. WALKER.
div.p:
An Infante •
Teneantur peccato originali?
Sint Baptizandi?
Baptizati regenerentur?
Aff.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Inceptoris HVGONIS WILLIAMS.
div.p:
An
Omnia ad ſalutem neceſſaria in ſcripturis contineantur? Aff.
Traditiones non ſcriptae aequipolleant ſcripturis? Neg.
Lectio ſcripturarum ſit laicis permittenda? Aff.

div.head: Quaſtiones Inceptoris MORGAN WINNE.
div.p:
An
Iuſtitia qua coram Deo comparemus juſti ſit imputata? Aff.
Aliquis in hac vita poſſit legem Dei implere? Neg.
Opera renatorum ſint meritoria? Neg.

div.head: Quaſtiones Inceptoris ANT. CLOPTON.
div.p:
An
Chriſti paſſio vero ſatisfecerit pro peccatis mundi? Aff.
Salvâ juſtitiâ divinâ punitus ſit Chriſtus ob peccata aliena? Aff.
Chriſtus ſibi etiam aliquid meruerit? Neg.

div.head: Quaſtiones Inceptoris GILB: SHELDON.
div.p:
An
Papa ſive dinectè ſive indirectè jus habeat deponendi principes Chriſtianos? Neg.
Clerici ſint als obedientiâ magiſtratus civilis jure divino exempti? Neg.
Iuramentum fidelitatis quod à Romano-Catholicis in Angliâ exigitur licitè ab illis praeſtari poſſit? Aff.

div.head: Quaſtiones Inceptoris THOM •• LEGH.
div.p:
An Poteſtas clauium
extendat ſe ad ſupremum Eccleſiae regimen? Neg.
ſolis Eccleſiae paſtoribus conceſſa fuerit? Aff.
communiter & independenter à Petro omnibus Apoſtolis conceſſa fuerit? Aff.

div.head: Quaſtiones Inceptoris EDVARD. WILLIMOTE.
div.p:
An
Chriſtiani legem moralem neceſſario teneantur obſervare? Aff.
Lex judicials Moſaica Chriſtianum obliget Magiſtratum? Neg.
Signo Crucis in baptiſmo & genu-flexione in coena Dominicâ vti oportent? Aff.

div.head: Quaſtiones Inceptoris PET. WENTWORTH
div.p:
An
Iudicium contracionis in fide articulis ex ratione ſit ſumendum? Neg.
Detur hodi • eccleſia triumph ••• ?. Aff.
Pericopae Evangelicae & Epiſtolares recte in Eccleſiâ Anglicanâ retineantur? Aff.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Inceptoris ARTHVRI WINGHAM.
div.p:
An
Seceſſus Eccleſiae Anglicanae à Papatu fuerit ſchiſma? Neg.
Haeretici quâ haeretici ſint morte mulctandi? Neg.
Lutherani (quos vocant) & Calviniani poſſint in vnam Eccleſiam coaleſcere? Aff.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Inceptoris IO. MORRIS.
div.p:
An
Pentateuchus Samaritanus ſit Moſaicus? Neg.
S. Scriptura Ebraica ſit à Iudaeis corrupta? Neg.
Editio vulgata Latina habenda ſit authentica? Neg.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Inceptoris EDM. STAVNTON.
div.p:
An
Sit aliquod peccatum ſuâ naturâ venialeNeg.
Deus author peccati ex Reformatorum placitis ſtatuatur? Neg.
Beata virgo fuerit abſ
que peccato originali?Neg.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Inceptoris RICHARDI PARRE.
div.p:
An religio proteſtantium
ſit in perniciem animarum? Neg.
ſit nupera vel novitatis rea? Neg.
ſit reconciliabilis cum praeſenti Romana? Neg.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Inceptoris GVILIELMI PAGE.
div.p:
An
Purgatorium Pontificium poſſit probari ex antiquis Patribus? Neg.
Conſenſus ſanctorum Patrum in Dogmatibus theologicis ſit retinēdus? A.
Sancti defuncti, ante reſurrectionem, ad claram Del viſionem, admiſſi ſint? Neg.

div.head: QVAESTIONES IN IVRE CIVILI DISCVTIENDAE IN VESPERIIS.
Quaeſtiones Inceptoris GEORGII RYVES
div.p:
An
Liceat de delictis tranſigere? Aff,
Fama probata faciat plenam fidem? Neg.
Statuta trahantur ad praeterita? Neg.

div.head: QVAESTIONES IN PHILOSOPHIA DISCVTIEND AE IN VESPERIIS.
div.p:
An
Homo naturaliter appetat ſcire? Aff.
Melancholici ſint maxime ingenioſi? Aff.
Poetae in ſuis fabulis exquiſitiſſime Philoſophati ſint? Aff.
Respondente ROB. ANTROBVS.

div.head: QVAESTIONES IN S. THEOLOGIA DISCVTIENDAE OXONII IN COMITIIS 14o. Die Iulij, Ann. Dom. 1634.
div.p:
An
Leges humanae obligent conſcientiam? Aff.
Ob metum ſcandali infirmorum licita ſemper ſint dimittenda? Neg.
Sanctificationi Diei Dominicae repugnent quae fiunt corporis recreandi gratia? Neg.
Respondente THO: LOCKEY.

div.head: QVAESTIONES IN IVRE CIVILI DISCVTIEND AE IN COMITIIS.
div.p:
An
Expenſae in ſtudiis factae ſint in legitimam conferendae? Neg.
Scholaris cedens bonis libros retineat? Aff.
Pro ſcholis vel Eccleſiis aedificandis vendita poſſint retrahi? Neg.
Respondente THO: READ. LL. B.

div.head: QVAESTIONES IN PHILOSOPHIA DISCVTIEND AE IN COMITIIS.
div.p:
An
Cometa poſſit eſſe de materia coeleſti? Aff.
Animae intellectivae ſint aeque perfectae? Aff.
Cerebrum ſit membrum frigidiſſimum? Aff.
Respondente RICH: NEVIL Art. Mag.
